result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Motion to withdraw as counsel/Motion for bail modification / Defendant Erik W Parlow in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Jaeger.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Jaeger motion to withdraw as counsel. Mr. Parlow states he no longer wishes Atty. Jaeger to represent him. Court permits Atty. Jaeger to withdraw as counsel on all 5 pending cases. Mr. Parlow stated he is attempting to obtain new counsel possibly Atty. John Schiro, he is planning on proceeding to trial on 1/26/2016 date. Trial date to remain on the calendar. If Court does not try OWI case on 1/26/2016, Court informs defendant he will try one of the bailjumping case. Mr. Parlow motion for bail modification. State opposes defendant's motion. Court denies defendant's motion to modify bail. Clerk to contact Atty. Schiro and schedule case when he is available for status hearing.

Defendant Erik W Parlow in court with attorney Lauria Ann Lynch-German.  Defendant in custody on warrant on 15CV270. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Lynch-German motion to withdraw as counsel. Defendant statement that he has filed an interlocutory appeal in Madison. Court grants Atty. Lynch-German's motion to withdraw as counsel. Court sets bail on 15CF270. State recommends significant cash bail of $70,000 with absolute sobriety. Defendant statement. Court sets bail on 07CF47 $10,000, 09CF31 $10,000, 15CF2 $10,000, 15CF201 $10,000, 15CF270 $20,000. Bond previously posted shall be applied to the bond amounts. Court finds good cause for not conducting initial appearance on 15CF270. Cases referred to the Public Defender's office. Case 09CF31/15CF2 will be rescheduled for trial at a later date when new counsel is appointed for defendant.

Called with 09CF31 and 07CF47. Defendant Erik W Parlow in court with Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests $2500 cash bail. Statement by counsel. Court orders $2500 cash bail with conditions:   Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.   Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. Defendant ordered to wear scram bracelet. Counsel requests preliminary hearing; waiving time limits. Preliminary hearing scheduled for 2/4/15 at 3:30 pm. Defendant taken into custody.
Amended
Dispatch contacted with Judge Malloy's request to have defendant picked up and was informed that Milwaukee County does not pick up on Ozaukee County warrants.
